POLK COUNTY, FLORIDA , SHERIFF GRADY JUDD 
 
 An illegal Immigrant in Polk County , Florida , who got pulled over in a routine 
 traffic stop ended up 'executing' the deputy who stopped him. 
 
 The deputy was shot eight times, including once behind his right ear at 
 close range. Another deputy was wounded and a police dog killed. 
 
 A state wide manhunt ensued. The murderer was found hiding in a wooded area with his gun. After he shot at them, SWAT team officers open fired and hit the guy 68 times. Now here's the kicker: 
 Naturally, the liberal media went nuts and asked why they shot the 
 poor undocumented immigrant 68 times. Sheriff Grady Judd told the Orlando Sentinel: Talk about an all-time classic answer. 
 
 
 
 'Because that's all the ammunition we had.'

 I'm going to write this one down because it's worth remembering.
 
 "Gun show loophole" 
 "Assault weapon"
 "Cop Killer bullets"
 "undetectable ceramic guns"
 "reasonable gun laws"
 "gun lobby"
 "illegal guns"
 
 Are these factual items or, (What is it you now seem to hate?) "emotional rhetoric"?
 
 Yeah, sinjin. This is one we can agree on. Those who use "emotional rhetoric" don't mind one bit if it suits their agenda. 
 
 Fortunately, gun rights advocates aren't LIMITED to their exclusive use like anti-gunners are because they can also rely on facts.
 
 It's a well known tactic that is starting to wear thin. Point out any factual information showing the benefits of a well armed citizenry, and see what the anti-gunners use to refute it. The facts will be completely ignored (can't use facts if there are none to support your argument) and the result will be a BARRAGE of that evil "emotional rhetoric" that sinjin hates so much. 
 
 Although, there are a few instances of liberals attempting to use facts.....
 
 ...like the Kellerman Study. Remember? ("A gun is 46 times more likely to be used on its owner than in self defense") Of course, this conveniently included suicides and spousal homicide. I wonder, If a person drank anti-freeze, or had it injected by his or her spouse, was this included in the study? After all, THE END WAS THE SAME since it was the END that was desired REGARDLESS OF THE MEANS. 
 
 If you weren't suicidal, or you got along with your spouse a gun was 2 TIMES MORE LIKELY TO BE USED IN SELF DEFENSE.
 
 (There's also a logical test to see if this is true: If guns were truthfully 46 times more likely to be used on their owners, wouldn't we see police stations giving their weapons away to criminals? This way the cops could "take them away and use them on their owners", right?)
 
 So even if anti-gunners do try to use facts, you have to watch closely for "cherry picking" or just plain slanted studies......
 
 ...such as that VPC study that concluded that over 400 children a year were killed by guns? (Of course, 17 year old "children" who were shot by police in the commission of a felony were also counted in this "study". Remove those "children" who were in the act of committing violent felonies and the number suddenly dropped to LESS THAN THOSE KILLED BY FALLING OFF BICYCLES!)
 
 So you see, even though "emotional rhetoric" is used by both sides, anti-gunners are better served by its exclusive use, as those pesky "facts" have a way of screwing up their whole argument.
 
 
Those given to emotional rhetoric don't mind one bit if it suits their agenda.
